src/lib/components/Hello.react.js.description:
A component that leverages intro.js under the hood to provide the Hello component
from musicfox.io. Include the steps you'd like to highlight and more.

This component uses [intro.js](https://intro.js.com/) and thus far most endpoints for Steps
are implemented.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called whenever any of the
properties change

steps.description:
List of dictionaries containing each step, with "intro" and "element"
keys, at a minimum.

nextLabel.description:
nextLabel

String label for the "next" button

prevLabel.description:
prevLabel

String label for the "prev" button

skipLabel.description:
skipLabel 

String label for the "skip" button

doneLabel.description:
doneLabel

String label for the "done" button

hidePrev.description:
hidePrev

Boolean true to hide "prev" button in the first step, default is false, 
disabled (grayed-out).

hideNext.description:
hideNext

Boolean true to hide "next" button in the last step, default is false,
disabled (grayed-out).

defaultTooltipPos.description:
defaultTooltipPos

String default tooltip position (these can be changed per-step)

tooltipClass.description:
tooltipClass

String class of all tooltip CSS

highlightClass.description:
highlightClass

String class of all highlight over tooltip CSS (for the helperLayer) in
intro.js

exitOnEsc.description:
exitOnEsc

Boolean true exits with an esc keypress, defaults to true

exitOnOverlayClick.description:
exitOnOverlayClick

Boolean true exits if clicking on the overlay, defaults to false

showStepNumbers.description:
showStepNumbers

Boolean true shows the steps in the red circle, default true

keyboardNavigation.description:
keyboardNavigation

Boolean true allows navigating with the keyboard

showProgress.description:
showProgress


Boolean true shows the progress bar

overlayOpacity.description:
overlayOpacity

Number between 0 and 1 adjusts the opacity of the overlay layer

src/lib/components/ToDo.react.js.description:
A component that renders a bootstrap card with Github Markdown bullet points, the
ToDo component from musicfox.io. Optionally include a title, subtitle, and/or footer.

This component uses [react-markdown](https://rexxars.github.io/react-markdown/)
under the hood, in the same fashion as the Dash Core Components Markdown component.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called whenever any of the
properties change

todos.description:
A todo list.

Enter the actual "todos" you have here as a list of strings or key-value pairs 
consisting of strings=['another list', {'orAnother':['string-key:list-value', 'pairs']}].

These will be your "bullet points" in the typical "list".

Markdown all the way.

title.description: The string title you'd like to include. Markdown all the way.

subtitle.description: The string subtitle you'd like to include. Markdown all the way.

footer.description: The string footer you'd like to include. Markdown all the way.

header.description: The string header you'd like to include. Markdown all the way.

dangerously_allow_html.description:
Boolean True or False (default)

True will allow Markdown HTML rendering but leave your clients exposed to XSS attacks.

Don't do this. But I'm into freedom; just don't blame ToDo when things go awry.

is_loading.name: bool
is_loading.description: Determines if the component is loading or not

component_name.name: string
component_name.description: Holds the name of the component that is loading

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer

containerProps.description:
An object containing custom element props to put on the container
element such as id or style
